title: Pitcher & Piano logo serif typeface
content:
Hi all,

Could anybody identify the serif used in this logo please? It's a logo for a chain of UK pub restaurants called Pitcher & Piano.

[http://www.studio-output.com/wp-content/uploads/2014/03/SO\_Projects\_PitcherPiano\_Thumbs\_01\_v2.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317163229/http:/www.studio-output.com/wp-content/uploads/2014/03/SO_Projects_PitcherPiano_Thumbs_01_v2.jpg)

Thank you,  
Benedict

Font: 

 Trajan Bold (modified) 

Solved By: 

 [fvilanakis](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317163229/http:/typophile.com/user/176276 "View user profile.")
author: BZA

comments.content:
It looks like a further emboldened & modified **[Trajan (Bold)](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317163229/http:/www.findmyfont.com/index.php/fonts/font-preview?fset=Adobe&ffam=Trajan%20Pro%20-%20Bold&fid=b3854fb3f87267df55432eac884381a6&fsize=60&text=PITCHER%20%26%20PIANO&wrap=2)**  
The /P looks like a modified /R and a top left serif is added to /N.

Trajan Bold (with modifications, like closing the bowl on the P), seems to be your best match:  
 [http://www.linotype.com/1547/Trajan-family.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317163229/http:/www.linotype.com/1547/Trajan-family.html "http://www.linotype.com/1547/Trajan-family.html")
